{"step_by_step_thinking": "The pre-maxillary hard palate refers to the anterior part of the hard palate. According to Document [0], the hard palate is covered by the palatine processes of the maxilla and the horizontal plates of the palatine bones. Document [25] states that the nasopalatine nerve innervates the palate and palatal gingiva adjacent to the maxillary canine teeth. Document [14] also mentions that the nasopalatine nerve supplies the anterior structures of the palate. Therefore, the nasopalatine nerve is responsible for supplying the pre-maxillary hard palate.", "answer_choice": "A. Nasopalatine nerve"}
